Detailed Description

cvmx-shmem supplies the cross application shared memory implementation

Revision
41586

Define Documentation

#define __CHECK_APP_SMDR
Value:
do { \
                if (__smdr == NULL) { \
                    cvmx_dprintf("cvmx_shmem: %s is not set up, Quit line %d \n", \
                        CVMX_SHMEM_DSCPTR_NAME, __LINE__ ); \
                    exit(-1); \
                } \
              }while(0)

int  remove 
) [inline, static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Common implementation of closing a descriptor.

Parameters:
dscptr shared memory descriptor
remove 1: remove the descriptor and named block if this this is the last user of the descriptor 0: do not remove
Returns:
0: Success !0: Failed

static struct cvmx_shmem_smdr* __smdr_init (  )  [static, read]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Initialize __smdr pointer, if SMDR exits already. If not, create a new one. Once SMDR is created (as a bootmem named block), it is persistent.
